episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of intriguing topics, including the unique structures in the human brain, a bizarre incident involving a Formula One driver and a moving wall, the concept of ghost ponds and their ecological significance, and a historical account of a woman with the most perfect feet in America.

facts.fact: My fact this week is that your brain contains a tender mother, a tough mother and a spider mother.
My fact this week is that at the 1984 US Grand Prix, it was thought that Ayrton Senna crashed into a wall on the 47th lap. But it turns out it was actually the wall that crashed into him.
My fact is, there is such a thing as a ghost pond.
Okay, my fact this week is that in 1912, the woman with the most perfect feet in America was devastated because her husband was jealous of all the attention she was getting.
